<StartAction>Knowledge</Start>
All skills boost, 1 for every 5 cleric levels

<StartAction>Magic</Start>
Spell Resistance increase, 10 + 1 for every 2 cleric levels

<StartAction>Plant</Start>
Natural AC, +1 for every 5 cleric levels, capped at 5

<StartAction>Protection</Start>
Concealment, 20% + cleric levels

<StartAction>Strength</Start>
Strength increase, 1 for every 7 cleric levels

<StartAction>Sun</Start>
Extra damage vs Undead, 1 + 1 for every 7 cleric levels

<StartAction>Travel</Start>
Immunity to Movement Speed Decrease

<StartAction>Trickery</Start>
Invisibility

<StartAction>War</Start>
Attack increase, 1 for every 10 cleric levels

<StartAction>Air</Start>
Immunity Increase vs Electric, 20% + cleric levels

<StartAction>Animal</Start>
Increases damage of Animal summons, 1 for every 7 cleric levels

<StartAction>Death</Start>
Increases damage of Undead summons, 1 for every 7 cleric levels

<StartAction>Destruction</Start>
Damaging Fire shield, d6 + 1 for every 5 cleric levels

<StartAction>Earth</Start>
Immunity Increase vs Acid, 20% + cleric levels

<StartAction>Evil</Start>
Extra damage vs Good, 1 + 1 for every 7 cleric levels

<StartAction>Fire</Start>
Immunity Increase vs Fire, 20% + cleric levels

<StartAction>Good</Start>
Extra damage vs Evil, 1 + 1 for every 7 cleric levels

<StartAction>Healing</Start>
Regeneration, 1 for every 10 cleric levels
You get a +2 dodge bonus vs the opposite alignment on the Good-Evil axis. Neutrals get a +1 vs both Good and Evil. A further +1 is added when you have 10+ Cleric levels.

You can pray to your patron once a RL hour. Non-cleric characters have a 40% chance to gain a personal blessing. Clerics always get a party-wide blessing (as long as the party members are in the same area). The aformentioned blessings are based on your alignment. Clerics get an additional party-wide bonus if they have domains that match their patron's portfolio.

Druids that follow a god with Animal or Plant domains will act like Clerics and give an auto-success party -wide alignment blessing. They do not get any domain blessings (as they obviously don't have a domain).

All other characters add twice their Paladin, Rangers, Blackguards and Champions of Torm levels to the 40% base success rate. A level 30 Paladin would thus get an automatic success.

The duration of a prayer is 5 turns + 1 turn / 3 Cleric (or Druid) levels. This equals 5 minutes + 20 seconds for every Cleric level.

You can bind to a god (or: take a deity as your patron god) if you meet the alignment requirements. Everybody can bind to a god, and pray to it, but Clerics get the best mileage out of it. You can bind to a god in two ways:

a. You search for its idol in the game. Click on it to open a conversation which allows you to bind to it if you have the right alignment.
b. You enter the deity's name in the deity field on character creation. Mind that the deity will fry you if you pray without meeting the alignment requirements.

At this moment you are free to swap deities. When the system is complete there will be a severe penalty, though.

The idol stares back at you and nothing happens.

[ooc: you do not have the right alignment for this deity]
This deity looks favourably upon you. Do you want to let it be your Patron from now on?
This deity looks favourably upon you. Do you want to become its Cleric?
Tell me all about the Deity System [OOC info]
Taking a deity as your patron
Well, you know... there's so many of them and I really don't know if it's wise to concentrate on one. The others might get jealous or something. Goodbye!
Yes. This God will be the one I worship above all!
I have obligations elsewhere, I am afraid.
Yes. This God will be the one I worship above all!
